title: Accessibility testing for design system components
Add a component or pattern once approved
Accordion
description: Accordions, which use the UX principle of progressive disclosure, are a list of headers that can be clicked to hide or reveal additional content. By default, accordions are multi-selectable and borderless, however, props can be added to make them bordered and single-select.

title: Additional info
description: Additional info makes content easier to scan as it hides information that may not be applicable to all users or situations. We use the Additional info component to situate plain language help at the point of the process where it is most relevant.

title: Address block
description: Address block is used to highlight mailing and physical addresses and contact information for VA facilities (with some notable exceptions). It can also be used to display personal information we may have for a Veteran.

title: Alert - Expandable
description: A minimized alert style that can be used to alert a user to relevant information on the page that is not prompted by their own action. This component combines the Additional Info component with the Background-Color only Alert variation color schemes.

title: Alert - Sign-in
description: An alert component with specific content focused on helping users complete the sign in process.

title: Alert
description: Alerts keep users informed of important and sometimes time-sensitive changes.

title: Back to top
description: The Back to top component is a shortcut that allows the user to quickly navigate to the top of a long page of content.

title: Banner
description: Banners are for announcements that typically prepare a Veteran to visit a VA facility or to help them maintain their health. Banners appear at the top of the page, below the header and navigation components.

title: Banner - Maintenance
description: Banners specifically for site-wide system messages, typically system maintenance, which are fixed to the top of the viewport.

title: Banner - Official Gov
description: This banner identifies official websites of government organizations in the United States. They also help visitors understand whether a website is official and secure.

title: Banner - Promo
description: A promo banner is fixed content at the bottom of the viewport used for dismissible announcements such as new tools, news, etc.

title: Breadcrumbs
description: Breadcrumbs provide secondary navigation to help users understand where they are in a website. In addition, the breadcrumb tells search engines how the site is structured, and it can be displayed in search results. This can improve rankings, and provide users with additional context.

title: Button group
description: The default button group arranges each button as a separate element with a gap between them. On mobile devices, the buttons are arranged vertically.

title: Button - Icon
description: The button icon variation acts as a tertiary button which has equal visual prominence to Link - Action and thus can be used in contexts that require a mix of links and buttons.

title: Button
description: A button draws attention to important actions with a large selectable surface.

title: Card
description: A card groups short, related pieces of personalized information into a series of discrete containers, similar to physical index or playing cards. The goal of a card is to present a snapshot of information in one digestible chunk with the option to navigate to more detailed content. The user should be able to easily scan a sequence of cards and take action on the most relevant items.

title: Divider
description: Dividers are used sparingly to separate significant sections of content

title: Footer
description: A footer serves site visitors who arrive at the bottom of a page without finding what they want.

title: Footer - Minimal
description: The minimal footer can be used when navigating away would prevent the user from easily accomplishing their main task.

title: Autosave
description: Informs the user that we will, and have, automatically saved their progress in a form flow.

title: Checkbox
description: Allows users to select one or more items from a list. Checkboxes are an easily understandable way to indicate that users can select one or more answers to a question or items from a list.

title: Date input
description: Use the date input component to help users enter a date they would know or a date they can approximate.

title: File input
description: File input allows users to attach files, one at a time, to be uploaded.

title: Form
description: Form controls allow users to enter information.

title: Input message
description: Provides helpful, in-context information about an input, either before or immediately after a Veteran interacts with an input (e.g. on a form input that auto-saves).

title: Label
description: Labels associate a descriptive title with each form input used to collect information from the user.

title: Memorable date
description: Three text fields are the easiest way for users to enter most dates.

title: Need help?
description: A footer found on application pages that provides contact information for the VA.

title: Penalty notice
description: A required legal notice for all forms.

title: Prefill
description: Informs the user that information from their profile has been used to prefill form fields.

title: Progress bar - Segmented
description: A segmented progress bar updates users on their progress through a multi-step process.

title: Radio button
description: Radio buttons allow users to select exactly one choice from a group.

title: Select
description: A select component allows users to choose one option from a menu.

title: Statement of truth
description: The Statement of truth allows users to certify that the information they have provided in form is correct and true to the best of their knowledge and belief.

title: Text input
description: Text input allows people to enter any type of text unless otherwise restricted.

title: Textarea
description: Textarea allows people to enter any type of text.

title: Header
description: A header helps users identify where they are and provides a quick, organized way to reach the main sections of a website.

title: Header - Minimal
description: The minimal header can be used when navigating away would prevent the user from easily accomplishing their main task.

title: Icon
description: Icons help communicate meaning, actions, status, or feedback. This component provides an easy way to access the foundational iconography of the Design System.

title: Language toggle
description: The language toggle is our way of providing translated versions of select pages on va.gov.

title: Link - Action
description: Action links guide users to a new page to take an action or to start an online tool or digital service.

title: Link - Collection
description: Collections of links that allow users to navigate to related content within and outside of the current content section.

title: Link
description: A link is a navigation element that can appear alone, inline (embedded), or in a group with other links. A link can trigger a download, but in general links go to internal or external pages when clicked.

title: List
description: A list organizes information into discrete sequential sections.

title: Loading indicator
description: A loading indicator provides a clue to ongoing activity when the site needs to load additional content.

title: Crisis Line Modal
description: The Crisis Line Modal is found in the Header of VA.gov and provides contact information for the Veteran Crisis Line.

title: Modal
description: A modal disables page content and focuses the user’s attention on a single task or message.

title: Notification
description: Provides a visually distinct card in order to surface time-sensitive updates and action items.

title: OMB info
description: Provides text required by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to be present on all forms.

title: On this page
description: The On this page jump links component summarizes the sections (&lt;h2&gt;s) at the top of long pages and allows users to jump down the page to the respective section.

title: Pagination
description: Pagination is navigation for paginated content.

title: Privacy Agreement
description: Used on the review step of a form flow to provide a link to the privacy policy content and provide a confirmation checkbox.

title: Process list
description: The process list, also known as the subway map, is used in a static informational context to describe the process to apply for a benefit or to provide tracking information to a user where they are in a given process.

title: Progress bar - Activity
description: A progress bar provides status as the system is taking an action on behalf of the user.

title: Search Input
description: The Search input component lives in the global header of VA.gov and on search results pages, and can be paired with type-ahead functionality. Type-ahead displays up to five suggested search terms in a dropdown below the Search input field while the user is typing a query. The goal of type-ahead is to help Veterans navigate to relevant content more quickly by providing them with suggestions that match the characters they type.

title: Sidenav
description: Hierarchical, vertical navigation to place at the side of a page.

title: Summary box
description: The summary box component helps Veterans quickly identify must-read information on a page. Use this component to highlight a small chunk of the most important information on a page, like eligibility criteria or coverage under a particular VA benefit.

title: Table
description: The table component organizes data into columns and rows.

title: Tabs
description: Tabs organize related groups of content within the same hierarchy into parallel views that a user can easily navigate between.

title: Tag
description: A tag draws attention to new or important content.

title: Telephone
description: The telephone component captures the many variations of phone numbers displayed on VA.gov.

title: Component name (singular)
description: This text provides the overall purpose and function of the component.

title: Redirects
description: A URL redirect forwards both visitors and search engines to a different URL than the one requested. Teams should implement a redirect or request a redirect whenever they change a URL or remove a page.

title: Dates, times, phone numbers, and addresses
Social security or VA file number
Keep a record of submitted information
Know how their information is updated
Know when their information is prefilled
Stay informed of their form submission status
